Reviews.Title: Very Pleased So Far!! 5 Stars For A Under $100 camera
Reviews.Author: Rude Boy 1979 "Ralph"
Reviews.Content: I was scared to buy this seeing the one star reviews but I figured at the price ($79 on Amazon) I could give it away if I was not happy with it. I know a lot of poor people who would be very appreciative to get anything for free. I have now owned 6 digital cameras. The two being the ones that I used the most were a Canon 2 mp ultra compact one I bought about 8 years ago, and a Samsung 8 mp compact one I bought 4 years ago (Digimax i85 http://www.amazon.com/Samsung-Digimax-Digital-Camera-Optical/dp/B000VQ8MB2/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid;=1324849121&sr;=8-4). The other 3 cameras I bought were too bulky and I gave them away to family pretty quickly.My general experience with digital cameras after 8 years of using them is they don't last forever. And usually when they break I'm angry that I spent $250 to $400 on it. So with that in my mind I wanted one under $150 with an optical zoom, compact size, and HD video (at least 720p). My Samsung broke on me while I was home on vacation (I work overseas and don't see my family much in person). I bought the Samsung based on a recommendation from the techy comedy news show called "Attack Of The Show" and they loved it. Well I hated that camera but I had a good amount invested in it so I kept it. I'm happy now that it broke because now I have a camera I really enjoy, this Kodak.The Kodak was much under $150 it was even cheaper then $100, so that was a easy pick. On top of it having an optical zoom, and HD 720p video, it has a rechargeable battery, a great bonus as I hate throw away batteries if I can avoid that. So I took the plunge and got it a week ago. I know I am in love with this camera because despite it being so inexpensive it's very very fast! This camera takes pictures the instant you click the shutter, I have never had a digital camera as fast as this one. The pictures so far have also been very sharp using the smart photo setting (everything auto). I also just tried out the video (720p) and it looks very sharp compared to my low resolution cameras before. Kodak provides a simple book with it and online a pdf book thats more detailed. They also have video instructions online which I thought were cool to watch and a help since I like to only turn on a camera and start shooting assuming it can do everything on its own.The camera can do editing and has instant sharing to your Facebook page but I am not interested in those features as I will crop the photos and such using my laptop, but they are there. And I can pop out the memory card and download the photos myself, but it's on there in case you like that. I really like that it has a film start button and a separate photo shoot button so you don't have to switch modes, that is the first camera that I've owned to do that, very easy to operate. The auto settings seem very good, they are called smart photo, and the camera really seems to be great in auto. I have not played with the sports modes or such but may as I gain experience with it. It seems to be doing a great job just on its own so I may never ever mess with the manual controls!Overall for a $79 camera I rate it a 5 out of 5, I may buy another one and keep it until this one breaks so that down the road I'll know I have another one of these around, I'm that happy with it. This is my first Kodak product and I always considered them low end because of the price and old Instamatic camera days, but hey, I'm a Kodak customer now, GOOD JOB!BTW I read when from anothjer review here, I was buying this, that it only took up to a 4gb card, the manual says it takes up to 32gb card so I'm bummed that I bought a smaller card then I wanted, so keep that in mind. Also one of the one star reviews talked about their daughters camera freezing up, the firmware upgrade on Kodak's site says that is there for a freezing issue, so that may have fixed it before it died. The other one star review was about one purchased on Ebay so possibly it was used and abused, who knows. Sometimes you get varying tolerances between the same model so maybe they just got lemons, maybe peoples expectations are too high for a under $100 camera, maybe people are trolls and are trying to kill Kodak from selling their products, who knows, I know I really like mine and wanted to share that with the Amazon community.5 out of 5, great camera for the price and really a great camera for something as compact as it is!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ruth P.H.
Reviews.Content: I purchase this camera about a week ago at Walmart.  I love this camera.  It may not be as fancy as a Sony or Canon but it works great. The pictures and videos are crystal clear.  I have taken photos and videos extensively of my grandchild and outside taking pics and video of my dog.I replaced my old camera that was also a Kodak but it was a 7 mp and the video was not very good.  I don't know why the other reviewers think the photos aren't clear but one thing you need to do is hold the shutter down part way before snapping the photo in order for the camera to focus.  I did extensive research on compact digital cameras, wanted to stay within a certain budget and also didn't like that some of the more expensive cameras only charged their batteryoff the computer.  This Kodak comes with an adapter that plugs in the wall to charge which is much more convenient.  I have used the share button once and it did send my video directly to Facebook.  I could not get it to send to my email but I think the video was too large.Overall this camera works great to me and I was happy I chose it.

Reviews.Title: I WON'T BUT THIS CAMERA AGAIN
Reviews.Author: Jeanette PM
Reviews.Content: My daughter who was graduating high school, bought this camera so that she would have a camera to use to document her last weeks in high school. We bought the camera at Walmart.A mere few days after she started using this, it froze on her a couple of times but she managed to do something to get it going again. I think she took the battery out then put it back in again to reset. We've had another Kodak digital camera in the past and it worked alright so that was one reason we bought this one, and because the price was within her budget.As far as the quality of photos, this is ok for everyday use, nothing fancy. If you're like my daughter and just use it for taking photos of your friends, then it will do. It does not take very good low light photos as she found out when she took the camera to a couple of concerts. Low light photos come out very grainy. The overall sharpness of the photos are less than the ones we take with a Canon point and shoot similar to this model. (Coolpix is a great model) Close up shots (macros) are not very good on this camera either. Compared with the Canon, the macro shots taken with this camera came out flat.Anyway, about a month after my daughter bought this camera, using it almost daily, the camera stopped working for her. When she tried to turn it on the lens would not come out. It was stuck. Rather than messing with it, I decided to send it back to Kodak since it was still within the one year manufacturer's warranty. I followed the instructions and sent the camera and accessories back to Kodak.I just received an email from Kodak this morning saying the warranty on this camera has been voided because they found "sand damage inside the unit". Now this is only after one month of normal use, albeit daily. The unit was not dropped nor buried in the sand. Whatever sand or dirt got in the unit is due to normal use. If they say there's sand damage, I can't argue with that. However, I think it sucks that the warranty is void because of that, AND that their repair costs are so ridiculously high!The offer they gave me is to repair the camera and I pay them $76.95 plus tax; return the broken camera to me with a $35 fee for them inspecting it and telling me I'm out of luck, or take advantage of their 'upgrade' program by giving me 15% discount on a new product. Whopee! eh?For the amount they're asking, I might as well buy a new digital camera! BUT IT WON'T BE A KODAK!

Reviews.Title: Great Beginner Digital Cam!
Reviews.Author: VAgriller
Reviews.Content: First of all this review must be viewed in light of the very reasonable price that this camera can be bought for. It will not shoot pictures comparable to the latest Canon DSLR! But for sub $100 pocket cam it is very good. Also I am admittedly not a camera pro or anything close to it. I got this camera for my son on his 10th birthday, and he is thrilled with it. It has some nice features, some that we haven't even figured out yet. But I like the facial recognition on this cam. The controls are easy to use, and everything still works well after a couple months use. If this camera lasts 2 years for him it was well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Sarah M. Botting "ssssarahhhh13"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Dad and it is very simple to use. It takes really great quality photos and for the more advanced user, it has the option to do some special effects. The screen is a lot larger than I thought it would be and it is very bright and clear. Overall, it is definitely an excellent camera and really a steal for the price it is listed at. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!
Reviews.Author: Barabara Chandler
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera i've ever dealt with! Its easy to use, and it takes GREAT pictures! When i recently just broke my last camera from dropping it, i desperatly needed a new one, because as my friends say, im the "queen of picture taking" and i never leave the house without it. My most favorite quality on the camera, is you can take 4 pictures and it forms it into a photobooth picture, or filmstrip. The only thing i wish it could do would be turning the filmstrip to black and white, or sepia. but you can always do that on an editing site. It has scene modes, like; action picture, portrait, up close and lanscape and so on. and it also has, film effects like;kodacolor, ektachrome and kodachrome which are all different strengths of regular color and T-max, and tri-x which are different strength of black and white, and also has sepia. I LOVE THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware...
Reviews.Author: Michael Pagan
Reviews.Content: I usually do not write reviews but this camera was so atrocious that I just had to. I have had around 7 or 8 different Digital Cameras (3-Fuji, 3-Olympus, 2-Canon & 2-Sony). I purchased the Kodak M532 on ebay and I am not very satisfied with the results. Most outdoor pictures are over exposed and totally washed out in the bright areas. I think there must be something wrong with this particular Kodak model because they already have a Firmware Upgrade available on the Kodak website (that really does not make any difference at all after you install it). Bottom line: if you want a Digital Camera to take some quality photos with don't buy the Kodak M532...

Reviews.Title: Dont buy it you will be sorry, terrible pictures!!!
Reviews.Author: K. lett "gemini6kl"
Reviews.Content: I owned 3 other previous Kodak easyshare models, and this one is the worst, terrible pictures that are only focused in the center of the picture, everything else is fuzzy at best . I can't believe kodak didn't recall this camera. Something is really weird here because the other kodak's i had which were  C series models took beautifull pictures, don't buy this junk it is a lemon.

Reviews.Title: manual
Reviews.Author: carol
Reviews.Content: It would of helped so much if I got a manual with it. Still having problems trying to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M532
Reviews.Author: pamdini
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my purchase of this Kodak camera.  You get alot of camera for your money.  It's easy to use and I especially like the share button.  I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Easy Share Camera
Reviews.Author: Marlene Merritt
Reviews.Content: Even tho I've been using this model for some years & put a LOT of miles (40,000 + pictures) on it didn't realize how to operate all the features until I read the instruction manual that came with this one...we all know how products & instructions separate when they get a few days old.  Chose & had a challenge finding this model because I liked it even before I discover all its capabilities.  Anyone who wants to go beyond point & shoot stills can trust this Kodak product to deliver the goods.  Seller was top-notch with delivery BEFORE estimated time expired.  Only one of the reasons I use Amazon.com when I want something that I can't find locally.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera so far.....
Reviews.Author: wy0002
Reviews.Content: the only reason why i'm not giving it 5 stars is cause it's refurbished, but that's just my preference. received the camera really quick, within days of my order.  took it out to play with and take photos.  all the photos are so nice and clear...so much better than my last camera.  i am amazed at how it works so far, for a refurbised camera, it sure looks a lot like a new one. the price is good too.  i don't like spending too much money on a camera. and the price along with the quality of the camera go well together as i'm not a camera expert and i just want a camera that will take good photos when i point and shoot.  pictures are easy to download onto my computer too. i wish though that i could just click the "share" button and my pictures would automatically upload on the internet without having to use hook it up to my computer, like my phone, but i guess this will do for now.8/3/12ok, now the camera is not so awesome. yesterday it froze on me several times...that's several times too many for me, i've decided to return the camera.

Reviews.Title: My screen no longer works
Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on 11/2011 and when I turned on the camera, the screen turned white with black lines running across. I was hoping it would last longer :(

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M532 14 MP Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Acker
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I expected.  Small, compact, takes great pics and vids.  One-day delivery.  Another speedy delivery for a great company. It's charging right now.  Soon I'll be taking masterpiece pictures.  Annie Liebowitz move over!!

Reviews.Title: great camera, easy to use
Reviews.Author: lfw106
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kodak EasyShare camera in the past few years. The company has made small, yet noticeable, improvements to their EasyShare line. It takes excellent pictures, even though I'm not at all a great photographer. You can either use the Kodak software for managing photos or download them with the operating system's built-in capabilities. For the price, this is really an excellent camera that is easy to use (separate buttons for capturing video and taking pictures) and many different colors too, which is important to some people.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Barbara A. Bailey
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! it takes great pictures and is not complicated to use! Even my mom can use it!!!

Reviews.Title: WORST CAMERA EVER
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS. LET ME JUST GET TO THE POINT.I GOT ONE FOR CHRISTMAS AND IT WORKED FINE FOR ABOUT 1-2 WEEKS. THEN WHEN I GOT IT OFF MY SHELF IT STOPPED WORKING. I ENDED UP GETTING ANOTHER AND THE SAME HAPPENED. SO MY PARENTS BUY ME ANOTHER ONE A YEAR LATER AND WHEN I DECIDE TO GO FILM THE SNOW OUTSIDE IT ALSO BREAKS DOWN AND THE LENS JAM UP.-LOW QUALITY. BREAKS WITH EASE-PICTURES ARE DEVELOPED AT EXTREMELY HIGH RESOLUTION AND BECOME GRAINY AND DISFIGURED-BATTERY LASTS ONLY A BIT-VIDEO FILES TAKE UP TONS OF SPACE AND HAVE BAD SOUND QUALITYI JUST HATE IT. NOT ONCE HAS A CAMERA BEEN SO BAD I HAVE NOTHING GOOD TO SAY ABOUT IT. NOTHING AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: Decent beginner point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Kamelle Jaye
Reviews.Content: For under $100 it isn't too bad. It takes a moment to get off one picture which I didn't like. I got this about 3 years ago and I thought it was awesome to begin with, seeing as it was my first camera. But the video mode isn't all too great, and the pre sets are decent. If you can I would recommend maybe the Canon powershot series and the Nikon coolpix series.

Reviews.Title: Okay, Camera just not what I want
Reviews.Author: Frances K. Everette-Gayther
Reviews.Content: The camera was okay but not what I expected.  I do like the different features it has, however.  Wouldn't buy another one from the seller though.

Reviews.Title: Horrible for quick moving subjects
Reviews.Author: Monet137
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for taking pictures of my baby and it is soooooo slow! It takes forever to take a picture even when the green sensor is on. Also if you accidentally hit the capture button too quickly is stalls with a processing window. I absolutely hate this camera and it has brought me more aggravation than it is worth. I do not recommend for the purpose of taking infants pictures. You are going to miss a lot of shots and get frustrated trying to.

Reviews.Title: Replacement
Reviews.Author: Sloughhouse Jack
Reviews.Content: I love Kodak cameras. I am not a professional.The other one I had liked it, shattered when I dropped it.This replaced it.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera.
Reviews.Author: Dixie man
Reviews.Content: I owned a Kodak DX4530 for many years and loved the quality of the pictures, especially low light pictures. So, I decided to purchase a new Kodak. I went to our local Office Depot and made the mistake of purchasing the Kodak M532. The pictures are terrible. I have 30 years experience as a photographer and I'm completely disappointed with this camera. I tried every way I could to get beautiful pictures with this camera and nothing has worked. After only a few months, 75% of the led screen went out. Only a tiny portion of the screen is currently working. Try to take a decent picture under such circumstances. This camera didn't last a full year. So, avoid this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: This is a good little camera.  It works well, and is simple and easy to use.  The picture quality is good for the price of the camera.  I took it on vacation and it held up well to travel.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the money.
Reviews.Author: 3rdtimer
Reviews.Content: I wanted something inexpensive and that had "in camera charging". Just what I wanted. 4 stars because the user interface is a little weird but the price was right. Too bad Kodak is tanking. Fine company that is part of the American way forever. The economy didn't get 'em.....the loss of film to the digital age was too much to overcome. If you find this one new and cheap grab it. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Replacement gift
Reviews.Author: Cherise
Reviews.Content: I got this for my BF to replace his last camera that I accidentally broke.  He hasn't complained about it at all since he got it, so it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: denise
Reviews.Content: product was very nice. clean and compact. I enjoy using this camera even though i bought it for my daughter for her birthday.

Reviews.Title: Don't Purchase
Reviews.Author: NanaNKS
Reviews.Content: I did not purchase this camera from Amazon but wanted to make people aware of my bad experience. I've only had the camera a few months and it won't turn on. Wish I had read the ratings before I purchased.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at this price
Reviews.Author: jim rhoades
Reviews.Content: I already own an M532 and a Z1285.  Both have features that are hard to find on a point and shoot at this price.  In camera editing is possible and the camera can be zoomed in and out while taking video.  Most cannot.  I bought this as a gift for my grandson.  It accepts up to a 32 gig card.

Reviews.Title: kodak easyshare m532 14 mp digital camers
Reviews.Author: Dorothy Wilson
Reviews.Content: i love the camera so easy to use just wish kodak hadn't quite making them this takes such good plain and clear pictures

Reviews.Title: Memory card slot was bad
Reviews.Author: CW
Reviews.Content: The memory card slot did not work.  I bought a memory card and right when I put it in, I got an error.  I tried several different cards and kept getting an error.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: gtzlilanelone
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom & it's way better than I could of imagine. The pictures come out great. Great deal for great quality project.

Reviews.Title: pleased
Reviews.Author: carol
Reviews.Content: I use the camera to take pictures of the animals at our shelter for Petfinder and it does a great job. I like the zoom very much. Too bad Kodak is out of business.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare M532 Digital Camara
Reviews.Author: MyraAnne "MyraAnne"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camara! I had one just like this before except it was black in color. I really like the features of this camara to edit my pictures. I do alot of scrapbooking and it is perfect for that. The price was awesome and the shipping and delivery was really fast. I received it before the estimated time given to me. I would recommend to anyone looking for a good, reliable camara that dont want to spend alot of money.

Reviews.Title: Best investment ever.
Reviews.Author: Bre
Reviews.Content: I almost don't want to tell you how amazing this camera is... hands down best camera I've ever gotten.  So many features to play around with, and such good quality.  I love it.  I want one for the rest of my life.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: kaykay
Reviews.Content: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS CAMERA IT TAKES GREAT PICTURES AND ITS ZOOM IS REALLY GOOD. FOR THE PRICE THAT I GOT THIS ITEM I'M OVER JOYED ABOUT THE PURCHASE.

Reviews.Title: kodak easy share digital camera
Reviews.Author: DM
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to replace a broken one. It takes great photos and is easy to use. It has alot of features and makes downloading photos to your computer easy. I especially like the rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: It's an OKAY camera
Reviews.Author: Shawn Brecka "Pbville Shawn"
Reviews.Content: The camera works, but only well enough if you want pictures of non-moving objects and you have a tripod. Honestly, it doesn't focus very well. Especially not if you want to get close up pictures. If you want close ups, go buy a Canon. I couldn't configure it to share, maybe that's just me though. In a few words, this camera is good if you want to have it be your 12-year-old's first camera, but nothing more.

Reviews.Title: Going out of business
Reviews.Author: garyyager
Reviews.Content: Kodak is getting out of digital camera business.  So you can probably pick one of these up pretty cheap. I got mine from woot for around fifty.Good:-Cheap-great pictures (get in the habit of pushing the shutter button halfway to pre-focus before taking the picture)-uses super common micro usb connector/charger & SDHC cardsBad:-kodak customer support for digital cameras is not their highest priority-no view finder-navigating the menus to change settings.  If you really like to control your shots, this isn't a camera for you.-easyshare nonsense.  Honestly it's much easier to use picasa to transfer, edit and share your pictures.Best Use:snapshots - keep it on it's smart, auto-everything setting and remember to pre-focus

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift for my mom
Reviews.Author: otis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my 65 yr old mom. Although she's not very technological, she has learned to use the camera quite easily.Just a month after receiving the camera she took a trip to the beach and too several nice, good quality pictures.I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed - not worth the $$ or headache
Reviews.Author: maximum verbosity
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I am not difficult to please nor did I expect this camera to be anything more than a basic point-and-shoot.  But I did expect it to take clear, visible photos without a lot of hassle.  And I did expect this camera to be simple and easy to operate without having to carry a manual around with me (or in this case, my laptop or tablet computer because the "extended manual" is only online).  I am also fairly technologically savvy - I know my way around my electronics with ease and rarely have any difficulty figuring out how things work.That said, I have to say that I feel that I wasted my money with this camera.  Even with the added in accessories (camera pouch, charger, SD card, battery, USB cord), it wasn't worth the sixty $ I paid.  The camera takes photos that are unreliable at best.  When I attempted to take a photo of my sons playing in their band concert (a very well lit gymnasium and I wasn't more than 30 feet from them), I found I couldn't get a decent shot.  If I didn't use the flash, they were blurry because I couldn't hold the camera steady long enough (noone could without a tripod).  If I used the flash and just the very basic setting where the camera does it all, the picture was so dark I could barely see them.  My cell phone flash works better than that.The other annoying things are that I cannot figure out how to change the setting on how long the photo stays on the screen after you take it.  It seems like forever which not only wastes the battery, but causes you to miss shots while you're waiting for the camera to finish.  The menu is not very intuitive, it's very difficult to find the settings to change things like what type of lighting you're using, which ISO, etc.  Most cameras have this basic stuff easy to find (again, my cell phone camera does).Finally, I have very small hands for an adult.  I found this camera felt too small and it was difficult to push the button to take the photo - I often ended up turning the camera off or accidentally turning on the video recorder instead.I paid fifty-nine $ for this camera which included a neoprene case, USB cord, SD card, battery and wall charger.  I don't think it was worth that much - the accessories are worth more than the camera.  Maybe I'm just too frugal, but to me, that's a lot of money to spend on something that doesn't work.  Maybe others are able to give away $100 items if they don't like them, but I don't have that kind of throw-away money.  I'd value this camera at around $30 considering it only works under ideal conditions.All in all, I wish I had saved the money I spent on this camera and paid a little more for one that actually worked.  It might be appropriate for a young child (though not for this price). As far as photo quality goes, unless you're only going to take pictures of things that are not moving and are in bright sunlight, you're probably going to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Walmart for $99.00 including insurance and I love it. Takes great photos and great videos. Its a good buy for $99.00 dollars!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: rocio
Reviews.Content: i have just bought this camera it is so great the images are so clear i really recomneded you this product....

Reviews.Title: Good experience
Reviews.Author: James A Anderson
Reviews.Content: I read the bad reviews and bought in anyway because I trust Kodak. My experience has been just the opposite.  Took nice pictures right out of the box.  Charges fine.  My only complaint is the pre-view is tough to see in the sun. I only use it for business so I havent explored all the other features. Small, fits in my pocket, inexpensive and does the job. I'm satified.

Reviews.Title: CHEAP AND FAST SHIPPING
Reviews.Author: ha
Reviews.Content: I BROUGHT THIS FOR A FRIEND AND SHE LOVES IT, IT IS VERY LITE AND EASY TO USE, BUT I LIKE THE UPGRADE BETTER

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Katie Rachar
Reviews.Content: I buy these cameras 2 at a time because I'm not good with keep ahold of them. I drop everything but after a good 6-8 months the screen turns pink and I have to get a new one BUT I take 300-500 pictures a month

Reviews.Title: A little blurry at times.
Reviews.Author: Danella Hunt
Reviews.Content: This camera works great. Sometimes the photo will turn out slightly blurry if not held perfectly still or if used without the flash on, but most of the time I do not have any problems.

Reviews.Title: camera not working good
Reviews.Author: jenni jaime
Reviews.Content: this is my 3 rd camera ordeed and it keepstelling me lens interferrence which i dont know what thats meaning,,,but i love this camera so much...

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: ThatsJustKeisha-Reviews
Reviews.Content: I AM A VLOGGER ONLINE SO I NEEDED A CAMERA I CAN CARRY EVERYWHERE SO THATS A PLUS I PURCHASE MINE FROM K-MART SO I LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Tammy Menebroeker
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera for taking basic pictures but decent pictures. I guess it's fine if your in regular lighting. Anything indoors or out, that requires any kind of flash you can forget about. They ALL come out dark and grainy. No matter how I set the flash. Terrible disappointment. None of the pictures came out at my Nieces Wedding.

Reviews.Title: CHERRY
Reviews.Author: DENNY JONES
Reviews.Content: Everything you would want will hold 16 shots without card and take short videos but kinda expected a card since used.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA FOR STARTERS
Reviews.Author: MR. KENT
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because my girlfriend is a kindergarten teacher who needs a camera that she can use in the class room. I had to keep in mind that she IS NOT the most advanced person when it comes to tech. So, I needed something that was easy to use, had pretty good resolution (for the kids) came in a cool color and, could fit in her purse. Enter the Kodak EasyShare M535. This camera had all the stuff I was looking for and 14 MP! Now, if only I can actually get her to use it

Reviews.Title: High Quality and High Value Camera
Reviews.Author: Osman M. Aly "OSMAN ALY"
Reviews.Content: This Camera is capable of taking sharp pictures with amazing details. Adaptable to the scenic situation, e.g. sports, landscapes close-ups, etc. Packing advanced features in a small camera is certainly welcome. In addition the best convenience for meis that it can fit in the shirt pocket or any pocket. I just love it.

Reviews.Title: KODAK EasyShare M532- NOT WORKING out of the BOX!
Reviews.Author: Nubian "Nubian"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera for $99.00 at Walmart YESTERDAY-Aug 3rd....NEW, sealed in BOX. I charged the included battery for 15-16 hours total. The only thing this camera did was light up the ON button.. It WOULD NOT turn on. The shutter never came out AFTER the battery was charged. The Extended Kodak instructions online & enclosed in the BOX does not state HOW LONG to charge it upon purchase.  I figure 12-15 hours is long enough for a Chargeable Battery.The ONLY GOOD POINT I Found...it that it does NOT need AA Batteries!!.Now it's THURSDAY, AUG 4th-THE NEXT DAY...& I'm on my way back to Walmart to get my $110.00 back. I'm not even going to bother to ask for a replacement.WHAT A RIP OFF.....giving this Camera ONE STAR!!I'll look elsewhere and check for other camera reviews.

Reviews.Title: OK for daytime use only
Reviews.Author: kati
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because there were a bunch of 5 star reviews. Now that I'm coming back to leave MY review I see a bunch of 1 star reviews too. The camera has some cool features like share right to facebook or email, but the quality of pictures in dim light or at night is terrible and it took horrible video at a concert. Sad to say I'll never be able to get that experience back with a video I can actually watch. If your just purchasing it to take indoor pictures or pictures outside during the daytime it would be just fine. If you want to take video that is clear or pictures at night, you'll need to invest in a better camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Donella Porter "romance reader"
Reviews.Content: I ALWAYS BUY KODAK CAMERAS. THE ONLY PROBLEM WITH THIS ORDER, THE WRONG POWER ADAPTER CHARGER. I WAS SET THE CHARGER FOR THE UK INSTEAD OF THE US.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: che923
Reviews.Content: I liked the camera the first week  it worked very nicely and then it stopped i figured it needed the batteries charged nope that wasnt the answer.  Took it to a friend who fixes cameras  he told me it was no good so i threw it away.  Hopefully i will get one for my birthday.  I am done with Amazon and those who sell through it.  This isnt the first time I have had things like this happen to me.

ProductInfo.Features:
Zoom in tight or stay wide and fit the whole crew in with the 5X wide optical zoom lens
Dedicated video record button, 720p HD video, on-camera editing
One-button upload to e-mail, KODAK PULSE Display and other popular social networking sites
Li-Ion rechargeable battery, in camera charging and and SD/SDHC card slot, you can add up to 4 GB of memory
Kodak's Smart Capture automatically identifies the scene and adjusts camera settings for a great picture while Kodak's
Face Recognition automatically recognizes up to 20 pre-tagged faces so you can easily locate and share them later
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak EasyShare M532 14 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD - Green
